ClinicalDocument.title: Community Health and Hospitals: Health Summary(Example)

tr.td: 50 y/o caucasian F who presents with 4 day history of dysuria, urgency, cloudy urine. Urine dipstick reveals numerous WBCS, positive leukocyte esterase, small amount of blood. Ordered urine culture. Prescribed course of antibiotics trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole.

53 y/o caucasian F w/X year history of diabetes, and x/year history of HTN. Has continued to gain weight over past year. HgbA1c indicates poor glucose control. Cites recent stress and insomnia for weight gain. Reiterated importance of diet and exercise. Educated on sleep hygiene.

56 y/o caucasian female who presents 10 day history of fever, anorexia, cough productive of green sputum. Crackles in R lower lobe suggestive of pneumonia. Ordered chest xray, CBC, sputum culture. Prescribed course of levofloxacin.
57 y/o caucasian female with X year history of diabetes and a X year history of HTN. HgbA1c reveals poor control of diabetes. Increased long-acting insulin. HTN controlled.

59 YO white female with a 15 year history of diabetes and a 10 year history of hypertension. Has early coronary artery disease and COPD. Not well controlled on Furosemide and Propranolol. Will increase doses and council on weight reduction, exercise and diet.

60 YO white female with a 11 year history of hypertension. Improved control on current levels of Furosemide and Propranolol. Will increase Furosemide dose and council on weight reduction, exercise and diet.

62 YO white female with a 12 year history of hypertension. Reasonable control on current levels of Furosemide and Propranolol. Concerned about reduced pulmonary function. Will refer to Dr. Jones for further evaulation.
